cards.front: What limits the linear range of a real amplifier?
cards.back: Supply rail saturation: output clips at ±V_CC. Linear range is V_in < V_CC/A_V.

cards.front: Input loading formula for voltage amplifier?
cards.back: V_in = V_S × R_in/(R_in + R_S). Need R_in >> R_S to minimize signal loss.

cards.front: Output loading formula for voltage amplifier?
cards.back: V_out = A_V·V_in × R_L/(R_L + R_out). Need R_out << R_L.
GBP ≈ constant. Higher gain → lower bandwidth. BW = GBP/A_V.

cards.front: Typical R_in of a MOSFET input stage?
cards.back: ~10⁹ to 10¹² Ω due to insulated gate. Much higher than BJT.
Keeps operation in the linear region, minimizing THD (< 1%). Large signals cause clipping and harmonic distortion.

cards.front: Max efficiency of Class A with resistive load?
cards.back: 25%. With transformer-coupled load: 50%. Class B theoretical max: 78.5%.

cards.front: Complete voltage gain formula with all loading effects?

cards.back: Total Harmonic Distortion: ratio of harmonic power to fundamental power. Small signal → low THD (< 1%).

cards.front: R_out of emitter follower vs CE?
cards.back: CC (emitter follower): ~10-50 Ω. CE: ~10-100 kΩ. CC is much lower — ideal voltage output.
